item.description:

# WHY: Why we should write $\LaTeX$ in the formal way?

After getting deeper into $\LaTeX$ and paper writing, sometime I find there are numerous ways to present formula, like slash in $cos\theta$: $cos\theta$ or $\cos\theta$: $\cos\theta$, and $\R$ in Mathjax: $\R$ or $\mathbb{R}$ in $\LaTeX$: $\mathbb{R}$.

There are several problems exist for informal $\LaTeX$ writing:

  • The informal usage between $normal \ font$ ($normal \ font$ or $\mathnormal{normal \ font}$), $\mathrm{removed \ font}$ ($\mathrm{removed \ font}$), and $\text{text}$ ($\text{text}$)
  • Too specific grammars only for single modified or embedded $\LaTeX$ compiler like Mathjax (especially in markdown writing like my blog), like real number sets in $\LaTeX$ $\mathbb{R}$ ($\mathbb{R}$) or specific grammar in Mathjax $\R$ ($\R$), and right arrow in $\LaTeX$ $\Rightarrow$ ($\Rightarrow$) or specific grammar in Mathjax $\rArr$ ($\rArr$)
  • The informal but widely accepted or old notation like integral $\int f , \mathrm{d}x$ ($\int f \, \mathrm{d}x$) or $\int f dx$ ($\int f dx$), and vector presentation $\mathbf{v}$ ($\mathbf{v}$) or $\vec{v}$ (\vec{v})
  • Others problems are going to be added

There are flows causing by these problems:

  • Misunderstanding, revision needed from editors, even the rejection from the journal.
  • Too familiar with a modified $\LaTeX$ compiler to write the correct and accepted grammar in original $\LaTeX$ compiler, greatly decreasing the efficiency in paper writing.
  • Lower readers efficiency while reading your papers transferring between different idea.
